alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 12:56AM CST until January 27 at 12:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tchefuncte River Near Folsom affecting St. Tammany Parish. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tchefuncte River Above U.S. Highway 190 Near Covington affecting St. Tammany Parish. For the Tchefuncte River...including Folsom, U.S. Highway 190 Near Covington...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tchefuncte River near Folsom. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Areas of Spring Park and Albert Thompson Road will be inundated. Homes will flood if the river rises higher. Evacuation of those areas is recommended. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 13.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 16.5 feet just after midnight tonight. The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.6 feet on 01/01/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM CST.
